alert.note: Alert for Dearborn (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:46PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN DEARBORN, NORTHERN CAMPBELL, NORTHERN BOONE, HAMILTON AND SOUTHERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 346 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Hidden Valley, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Norwood, Forest Park, Fort Thomas, Newport, Sharonville, Monroe, Blue Ash, Loveland, Springdale, Reading, Montgomery, Harrison, North College Hill, Madeira, Wyoming and Cheviot. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 19. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 164 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 19. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
